Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 13.3 and σ = 1.1. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 20% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 12.2353
* 12.3742
* 12.8398
* 13.0964

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 12.2353: Incorrect
* 12.3742: Correct
* 12.8398: Incorrect
* 13.0964: Incorrect
